newsitem.title: USA: Health Mgmt Systems sees FY97 EPS rising.
newsitem.headline: Health Mgmt Systems sees FY97 EPS rising.

text.p: Health Management Systems Inc said Friday that fiscal 1997 earnings per share should be in the range of $0.75 to $0.77.
The estimate would be above those expected for fiscal 1996, which the company said earlier on Friday would be about $0.45 to $0.46 per share.
The company also said fourth quarter results would be lower than expected, at $0.15 to $0.16 per share.
To minimize risks in fiscal 1997, the company said, it is resetting expectations back to its standard 15 to 20 percent top line growth with 15 to 20 percent operating margins.
"This suggests fiscal year 1997 earnings per share in the range of $0.75 to $0.77," the company said in a release.

"In the interim, the company is experiencing strong cash flows, has achieved a significant decrease in days sales outstanding and retains a very strong balance sheet with zero debt," the company said.
Health Management shares fell by as much as 8-1/4 Friday morning.
First Call consensus estimate for fiscal 1997 earnings is $1.00 per share.
